StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: Varieties of Impulsivity in Opiate and Stimulant Users

Person.Organization: VIRGINIA COMMONWEALTH UNIVERSITYUNIVERSITY OF ILLINOIS AT CHICAGO

Policy.acknowledgement_statement: Please cite/reference the use of dbGaP data by including the dbGaP accession phs001647.v1.p1 https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/projects/gapprev/gap/cgi-bin/study.cgi?study_id=phs001647.v1.p1. Additionally, use the following statement to acknowledge the submitter(s) of this study: The dataset(s) used for the analyses described in this manuscript were obtained from the Varieties of Impulsivity in Opiate and Stimulant Users (VIOSU) Database found at https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/projects/gap/cgibin/GetSampleStatus.cgi?rettype=html&study_id=phs001647.v1.p1 through dbGaP accession phs001647. Funding support for VIOSU was provided by the National Institute on Drug Abuse and the Fogarty International Center at NIH through grant R01DA021421. We would like to thank VIOSU participants and the VIOSU research team for their valuable contribution to this research.
Policy.ic_specific_access_term: The use of data should be related to substance use disorder, ADHD, mood disorders, anxiety and stress disorders, ASPD/Psychopathy

GSR_Access.gsr_mode_label: Controlled-access (GSR are sensitive according to the Institutional Certification)

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Substance Use Disorders, IRB, NPU, MDS, GSO)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-SUD-IRB-NPU-MDS-GSO
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction:
Use of the data must be related to Substance Use Disorders. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval. Use of the data is limited to not-for-profit organizations. Use of the data includes methods development research (e.g., development of software or algorithms). Use of the data is limited to genetic studies only.
Genetic Studies Only (GSO)
